skill.name: Performance Fundamentals
skill.description: Auto-invoke when reviewing loops, data fetching, rendering, database queries, or resource-intensive operations. Identifies N+1 queries, unnecessary re-renders, memory leaks, and scalability issues.
skill.summary: Auto-invoke when reviewing loops, data fetching, rendering, database queries, or resource-intensive ...
skill.author: DanielPodolsky

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill containing performance best practices and review guidelines. No executable code, network calls, or file system access detected.

content.value_statement: Performance issues slow down applications and frustrate users. This skill automatically identifies optimization opportunities in your code.
actual_capabilities: Checks for memory leaks and cleanup issues
limitations: Focuses on common patterns, not all edge cases

use_cases.title: Database Query Optimization
use_cases.description: Review API endpoints and data access patterns to eliminate N+1 queries and improve response times.

use_cases.title: React Performance Review
use_cases.description: Analyze React components for unnecessary re-renders, memoization opportunities, and bundle size issues.

use_cases.title: Performance Checklist
use_cases.description: Ensure pull requests meet performance standards before merging into production.

prompt_templates.title: Database Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this API endpoint for database performance issues: [paste code]. Check for N+1 queries, missing indexes, and pagination.

prompt_templates.title: React Component
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this React component for performance issues: [paste code]. Look for unnecessary re-renders, missing memoization, and optimization opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Code Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this code for performance bottlenecks: [paste code]. Consider time complexity, memory usage, and scalability at 10k+ items.

prompt_templates.title: API Optimization
prompt_templates.prompt: Optimize this API response: [paste JSON]. Suggest field selection, pagination, compression, and caching strategies.

output: Found N+1 query pattern: User.findAll() followed by Post.findByUserId() in loop
Solution: Use include/join to fetch posts in single query
Add index on user_id column in posts table

best_practices: Always check for N+1 queries in loop patterns
Use pagination for any list that could exceed 100 items
Memoize expensive calculations with useMemo or equivalent
anti_patterns: Creating new functions inside render methods
Forgetting to clean up intervals and event listeners

faq.question: Which frameworks does this support?
faq.answer: Works with any framework. Examples include React, Vue, Node.js, Python, Ruby, and database queries.

faq.question: How does it detect performance issues?
faq.answer: Analyzes code patterns against known anti-patterns like N+1 queries, missing memoization, and scalability bottlenecks.

faq.question: Can it fix issues automatically?
faq.answer: No, it identifies issues and suggests solutions. Developers implement the optimizations based on recommendations.

faq.question: What data does it access?
faq.answer: Only reviews code you paste. No file system access, network calls, or data collection.

faq.question: How accurate are the suggestions?
faq.answer: Based on established performance patterns. Always test optimizations in your specific context.

faq.question: Is this suitable for beginners?
faq.answer: Yes. Includes explanations and examples to help developers learn performance concepts.
